summary: Vanderbilt University, often called Vandy, is a private research school in Nashville, Tennessee, founded in 1873. It was named after Cornelius Vanderbilt, who donated $1 million to help unite the country after the Civil War. Vanderbilt has ten schools and around 13,800 students from the U.S. and 70 other countries. It's known for its research and has many special centers, like the Robert Penn Warren Center for the Humanities. The university has a strong history of sports and academics, with many famous alumni, including politicians, Nobel Prize winners, and Olympic medalists.
title: Vanderbilt University
